title: Navigation Bar CSS
description:
The "div" used for grouping items such as the parent or the button div have their "display" property set to "grid" to position the elements inside. The properties "grid-template-columns" and "grid-template-rows" are used to divide the area into sections where we can easily slot each element with the use of "grid-area" property, we can set the starting row/column and the area each element will span. 

The properties "pointer-events" and "cursor" are there to allow us to change the mouse pointer into a click pointer when it enters certain elements of the navigation bar.

For the hovering events, we will take advantage of the CSS ":hover" for the image to capture the hover event, while also creating a ".highlight" class to add a highlight function whenever the mouse hovers over the label of a navigation button.

Other properties used are:

"z-index" which will determine the stack order of an element where the greater stack order is always in front of an element with a lower stack order. 

"gap" determines the gap between sections in the "grid". 

"transform" lets us rotate, scale, skew, or translate an element for better control of the image used.

"box-shadow" adds a shadow effect.

"align-items" specifies the default alignment for items inside a flexbox or grid container.

"max-width" and "max-height" will limit the maximum size of an element.
